docs.abstract: Verizon Communications Inc withdraws its application to offer long-distance communications services in Massachusetts, fearful that petition will be rejected by federal regulators (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Verizon Communications Inc. withdrew its application to offer long-distance communications services in Massachusetts yesterday, fearful that the petition would be rejected by federal regulators. Under the Telecommunications Act of 1996, the Federal Communications Commission would have been required to rule on the application by the end of this week.

docs.abstract: Shire Pharmaceuticals agrees to pay $4 billion in stock to acquire BioChem Pharma, in one of largest takeovers of biotechnology company; Shire's stock offering is nearly 40 percent more than latest closing price of BioChem; executives at each company say merger would combine BioChem's expertise in drug discovery with Shire's expertise in later-stage drug development and marketing (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: In one of the largest takeovers of a biotechnology company, Shire Pharmaceuticals of Britain agreed yesterday to pay $4 billion in stock to acquire BioChem Pharma, maker of the AIDS drug 3TC. Shire, a small, fast-growing and acquisitive drug company, will offer stock worth $37 for each share of BioChem Pharma. That is nearly 40 percent more than the closing price of BioChem on Friday.

docs.abstract: Continuum Entertainment, which developed first real-time computer strategy game to come out of Brazil, could be role model for Brazil's fledgling entertainment software industry; tiny industry, with fewer than dozen companies, is on par with game developers in United States in technical innovation; map; photo (M)

headline.main: High Hopes for Brazilian Company's Computer Strategy Game

docs.lead_paragraph: Climbing the stairs to the new third floor offices of Continuum Entertainment, which is housed in a squat glass building above a clothing store in a residential neighborhood here, Rafael Rodrigues Dolzan, 25, gestures at the two large, starkly empty rooms he passes along the way. ''We hope to someday have as many as 30 or 40 people working here,'' he said of the company's offices in this capital city of about 1.5 million in the state of Parana, in southern Brazil. ''But for now it is just us.''

docs.abstract: Fogdog, high-profile online sporting goods retailer, is acquired by Global Sports, which provides e-commerce services to retailers, for $38.4 million in Global stock; Fogdog releases third-quarter results, showing revenue of $5.9 million, and net loss of $8.5 million (M)

headline.main: Global Sports to Buy Online Retailer Fogdog

docs.lead_paragraph: Fogdog, a high-profile online sporting goods retailer, agreed yesterday to be acquired by Global Sports, which provides e-commerce services to retailers, for $38.4 million in Global Sports stock, the companies said. The deal comes on the heels of the sale of CDNow to Bertelsmann in July and the closing of Value America in August, two other stand-alone publicly held consumer e-commerce companies.
docs.snippet: Fogdog, a high-profile online sporting goods retailer, agreed yesterday to be acquired by Global Sports, which provides e-commerce services to retailers, for $38.4 million in Global Sports stock, the companies said.     The deal comes on the heels...

docs.abstract: Sun Microsystems announces record earnings and revenue in fiscal first quarter ended Oct 1; earnings rose 85 percent, to $510 million from $276 million in year-earlier quarter; revenue was $5.05 billion, increase of 63 percent over $3.15 billion a year ago (M)

headline.main: Sun Microsystems Reports Record Quarterly Earnings

docs.lead_paragraph: Sun Microsystems announced record quarterly earnings and revenue today, including strong sales in Europe, where other computer makers say they have faltered. But the company's stock ended down for the day, and analysts said a slip in gross profit margins was to blame. The earnings news, due after the market closed, came out earlier than planned because of a logistical glitch that set off a frenzy of midday trading. The company inadvertently posted the results on its Web site before noon, causing a flurry of buying that sent Sun shares as high as $119.50 before trading was halted for 40 minutes.
docs.snippet: Sun Microsystems announced record quarterly earnings and revenue today, including strong sales in Europe, where other computer makers say they have faltered. But the company's stock ended down for the day, and analysts said a slip in gross profit ...

docs.abstract: Yahoo posts third-quarter earnings that narrowly beat expectations, but company also suggests that failures and scaling back among dot-com advertisers has limited growth and might continue to do so; company reports earnings of $82 million on revenue of $295.5 million, 9.4 percent increase in revenue from second quarter; Yahoo's chairman-chief executive, Tim Koogle, says global Yahoo franchise is stronger today than ever before; photo (M)

headline.main: Yahoo Beats Earnings Estimates, but Sees Potholes on the Road Ahead

docs.lead_paragraph: Under close scrutiny from jittery technology investors, Yahoo posted quarterly earnings today that narrowly beat expectations, but the company also suggested that failures and scaling back among dot-com advertisers had limited growth and might continue to do so. The company reported earnings of $82 million, or 13 cents a share, one penny more than analysts' projections, and just more than double the company's earnings of 6 cents a share for the period a year earlier.
docs.snippet: Under close scrutiny from jittery technology investors, Yahoo posted quarterly earnings today that narrowly beat expectations, but the company also suggested that failures and scaling back among dot-com advertisers had limited growth and might con...

docs.abstract: Motorola Inc says third-quarter profit rose 66 percent, in line with Wall Street estimates, on strong sales of broadband equipment and computer chips; profit rose to $598 million compared with $361 million in year-earlier quarter; sales increased to $9.5 billion from $8.1 billion; net income totaled $531 million compared with $114 million a year ago (M)

headline.main: Motorola Reports Increase Of 66% in Quarterly Profit

docs.lead_paragraph: Motorola Inc., the big telecommunications and semiconductor company, said yesterday that its third-quarter profit rose 66 percent, in line with Wall Street estimates, on strong sales of broadband equipment and computer chips. The company, based in Schaumburg, Ill., said profit from operations rose to $598 million, or 26 cents a share, compared with $361 million, or 16 cents a share, in the quarter a year earlier. Sales increased to $9.5 billion from $8.1 billion but were less than the $10 billion Wall Street analysts had been expecting, according to First Call/Thomson Financial.

docs.abstract: 3Com Corp says Eric Benhamou has resigned as chief executive, but will remain chairman; he is being succeeded as chief executive by Bruce Claflin, president and chief operating officer; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: The 3Com Corporation said today that Eric Benhamou had resigned as chief executive, but would remain chairman. He is being succeeded as chief executive by Bruce Claflin, 3Com's president and chief operating officer.
docs.snippet: The 3Com Corporation said today that Eric Benhamou had resigned as chief executive, but would remain chairman.     He is being succeeded as chief executive by Bruce Claflin, 3Com's president and chief operating officer....

docs.abstract: Dell Computer Corp reports record second-quarter earnings and revenues, beating analysts' estimates; reports net of $603 million for quarter, compared with $507 million in year-earlier period (M)

headline.main: Dell Computer's Second-Quarter Earnings Beat Expectations

docs.lead_paragraph: The Dell Computer Corporation reported record revenues and earnings yesterday, beating analysts' estimates for its second fiscal quarter by a penny. But the company's revenue growth rate slowed for the third consecutive quarter, and some analysts questioned its continued ability to lead the industry. For the quarter ended July 28, Dell reported earnings of $603 million, or 22 cents a diluted share, up 19 percent from $507 million, or 19 cents a share, in the period a year earlier. Sales rose 25 percent, to $7.67 billion from $6.14 billion, in the quarter.

docs.abstract: StarMedia Network, whose Web portal has been premier gateway to material on the Internet in Spanish and Portuguese since 1996, faces mounting competition in Latin American market; Terra Networks and America Online have made Latin America's growing Internet market a major priority, and many of region's dominant media and telecommunication companies are also devoting huge resources to building up Internet businesses; StarMedia's shares have fallen precipitously; Fernando J Espuelas, its charismatic 33-year-old founder and chief executive, brushes off worries; photo (M)

headline.main: StarMedia Faces New Challenges in Latin America

docs.lead_paragraph: When rumors circulated last month that the American company StarMedia Network might be acquired by Terra Networks, the Internet industry found the story plausible. After all, StarMedia, based in New York, had one of last year's hot Internet stock offerings but had seen its shares fall precipitously. And its Web portal, which since 1996 had been the premier gateway to material on the Internet in Spanish and Portuguese, was facing increased competition in Latin America.
